name: hose
content:
hose noun
(PIPE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] (UK also hosepipe) a long plastic or rubber pipe, used to direct water onto fires, gardens, etc.: garden hose She doused the flames with a garden hose before calling emergency services.hose ban The severe drought has led to a hosepipe ban in eastern England.

hose noun
(CLOTHES)
[ U ] old-fashioned a word used especially in shops for tights and stockings: Even older women are wearing hose less frequently now. Under the dress code at that time, women teachers would have been required to wear hose and heels. Synonym
hosierySee also
pantyhose
[ U ] trousers worn by men in Europe in the past, either covering just the top part of the leg down to the knee, or long and very tight, usually worn with a short jacket called a doublet: The king is depicted wearing doublet and hose. These young gallants strutted around in tight hose and padded doublets.
